name: Residence Inn Seattle Bellevue/Downtown

reviews.text: A very good place to stay. Excellent breakfast included in the price, with lots of variety and food replenished as soon as they ran out. The breakfast was available from 7 (or7:30?) until 10 when we were there, and was quite crowded towards the end, when we happened to go...but still, always lots of food, variety, hot.
reviews.title: Great Family Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and helpful; pool looked great, although we didn't use it. The room itself was clean, nicely-decorated and made excellent use of space...little things like the TV rotating so it could be viewed from the sitting area or the bed. Nice bedding (hey! That's important when you're travelling!) It's about 15 minutes to downtown Seattle, but that probably explains its reasonable price. I'd definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So this hotel was worth every single penny. The location is very convenient since it's right off the freeway. The suite we were lucky enough to stay in had a full size fridge, a dishwasher, 2 electric burners, and a microwave. The bed was super comfy and the TV was on a great 360 swivel to you can watch TV while in bed or on the couch. And free wifi is ALWAYS a plus. This hotel doesn't have a business center like other hotels, but the Microsoft lounge is even better. 3 computers hooked up to a common printer, 2 big screens, and 3 xbox 360s for all your gaming needs. Free continental breakfast had a great selection (fresh waffles!) with plenty of seating.
reviews.title: Great suite hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights on a romantic getaway. We were surprised by how roomy and up to date it was. It was like having your own little condo. We even stayed in and ordered in one night. We found the bed very comfortable and the staff super friendly. They hand you a bottle of water as soon as you check in.
reviews.title: Would definitely recommend this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually stay at the Hyatt which I also love for the price difference I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Another great Residence Inn by Marriott, we will definitely come back!

reviews.text: nice locality.. very close to downtown bellevue.. good food options.. mall is also close by.. plus they have bus service from the hotel to various places.. till 10pm
reviews.title: excellent excellent

reviews.text: Monday through Thursday they also have Manager's dinner.. which is good
reviews.title: WATCH OUT FOR THE "EXTRAS"

reviews.text: While driving in the Bellevue area, my wife and I saw the "Residence Inn" sign on a building and decided to stop for the night. The appearance of the building was inviting so as I was driving, she went in to check it out. She came out after about 10 minutes and said that she had registered and paid.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a tad shocked with the room rate being charged as we were both seniors and I knew that this hotel chain offered senior rates. I was also SHOCKED to see that we were charged a $10.00 fee to park our car in the attached, unmanned parking area which is part of the hotel, not a segregated privately owned parking lot.
reviews.title: Best service I have had in a Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: After we unloaded our luggage and went through the lobby to our 1st floor "suite" (all suites / not rooms) I was going to peak to the front desk person regarding a senior discount. However I saw that there were some 12 people before me so I went to suite.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: My son, his 15 monthold daughter and I chose this hotel because it was near friends of his in Bellevue. We have stayed in three other Residence Inns and found them comfortable and spacious. This site is not spacious - neither bedroom could accomodate a crib; a pack 'n play. We ended up putting the crib in the living room but had to move an end table and lamp to do do. When we moved the furniture there was considerable dirt (hairball, candy wrappers) behind the furniture. We called and housekeeping immediately came up to vaccum. Otherwise the suite was clean.
reviews.title: Comfortable place to stay

reviews.text: I was concerned about the highway noise after reading the reviews. No question, there is highway noise but it is white noise and did not bother me - with earplugs at night.
reviews.title: It is new, but..

reviews.text: Compared to other Residence Inns that we have stayed in (Salisbury, MD and Portland, OR, Seattle, Lake Union) the rooms are small.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: All in all, the full kitchen, the availability of breakfast that can be brought back to the room, the pool area and exercise room, the hotel is very comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay,great area nearby

reviews.text: I am a frequnet visitor to the Bellevue area and recently went on vacation with my mother and 14+ month old daughter. We wanted a place with a kitchen for the baby and a place for the crib. I have stayed at over 12 Marriott Residence Inns in the past and over 50 other Marriott properties. We arrived at the hotel having booked a 2 bedroom room. The hotel did not have proper cribs, so I arranged to rent one. Upon arrival the rental furniture was sitting in the lobbly. Checkin was fine. I had requested a high up room to try and get away from highway noise. There was no offer to help with luggage. They brought the furniture and delivered it to the room but did not offer to help set it up. The room is much SMALLER than other Residence Inns. It is nice, modern but small. There was no place to put a full size crib either in a bedroom or the main living area. So I removed some furniture (end table and chair). Behind both was gross amounts of trash, hair and dirt. They came and cleaned. The next morning there was a problem with a tv, which they fixed promptly. We managed to set it up so that it worked with the crib, etc. We did ask if there was a larger room and was told that there is not.
reviews.title: All around wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They made a believer out of me. I will always stay here, and try to stay at a Marriott because of my stay here. We were greeted with water bottles. The place is immaculate. There is a Microsoft room with 3 computers, 3 Xbox's, and a big screen for families to play on. Our room was like a mini suite. The kitchenette has EVERYTHING you will need, including free microwave popcorn. It has pots, pans, silverware, dishes, cups, like I said everything you need. The bathroom was great with lots of counter space for all your traveling amenities. There is a shuttle that will take you to the transit center in Bellevue should you need it. The flat screen swivels to bedroom or living room. The hotel was a very well thought out design. Kudos to Marriott. Oh and I forgot to mention the free hot breakfast buffet in the mornings! Very awesome!
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be back!

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights with family and the hotel was able to accommodate my request to have adjoining suite. The hotel is clean, fresh and the rooms are just fabulous, especially each room comes with a small kitchen. It's a great place for family with kids on vacation. The hot breakfast is also good, though i would love to see more variety. Only drag is the hotel charges $10 for parking...what the heck...it's vacation and it cost more in downtown Seattle ;-)
reviews.title: Great hotel....will definitely chose this over other hotels in Bellevue

reviews.text: Our intention was to stay in downtown Seattle but we couldn't find any hotels available for the June 23-26 period that we were there. So at the last minute we ended up booking two studio rooms at this hotel in Bellevue. The rooms were quite spacious and equipped with every amenity for a long stay. The only problem was that for Seattle visitors, there were no travel options - you had to have a car to get there. The buffet breakfast which was included in the room rate was very decent and quite substantial - they even had waffles and pancakes. I also liked the laundry facilities which were available on site in the basement. Service requests were handled efficiently and promptly.Front desk staff were friendly and responsive and waived our parking fee when we mentioned the lack of a shuttle to Seattle.
reviews.title: Comfortable place to stay - but no shuttle to Seattle

reviews.text: Residence Inns provide a suite-like hotel room with a kitchen and free breakfasts. Both were very nice. The workout facility was OK but at least adequate for aerobic activity (free earbuds were a nice touch). Given the location of this property, I found it annoying that they charged for parking. Encountered some minor maintenance issues (like a broken water machine in the workout room that dispensed warm water). Very friendly front desk! Nice lobby area.
reviews.title: A nice property

reviews.text: Great place! Very convenient to the highway & locations in Bellevue/ Seattle. It was clean & very well maintained. The morning breakfast was a great option to start the day, including the Starbucks shop located right on the main floor. One opportunity for improvement is the parking garage. There are limited parking spots, and it felt a bit unsecured walking in late at night.
reviews.title: Modern & New & Convenient

description: Thrive on Long Stays. Located next to a nature reserve, experience beautiful Washington State in the comfort of our brand-new Residence Inn Downtown Bellevue hotel. We're just minutes from the Meydenbauer Convention Center, Bellevue Galleria, Art Museum and the 405 Freeway, as well as many activities including Lake Washington, scenic parks and hiking trails. Back at our Bellevue, WA hotel, enjoy a free hot breakfast buffet in the morning and mingle over refreshments at our free social hour on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Our extended stay hotel in Bellevue, WA will help you feel at home. Each one of our Bellevue suites offer separate living and sleeping areas, fully equipped kitchens and stylish furnishings. Our suites in Bellevue are also equipped with free Internet access to keep you connected. Later, unwind in our indoor pool, stay in stride at our fitness center or head outside to walk the nature trails. Our Residence Inn hotel in Bellevue, Washington helps you maintain a balance of work and life as you thrive on extended stays.
